Html:

types

<Type Name="BookSection">

    <DataTag>b:Author/b:Author/b:NameList</DataTag>

    <DataTag>b:Title</DataTag>

    <DataTag>b:Author/b:BookAuthor/b:NameList</DataTag>

    <DataTag>b:Edition</DataTag>

    <DataTag>b:Comments</DataTag>

 

any thoughts would be apreciated

andy

In your bibform, you have 2 title labels and you have an unofficial datatag TitleBook:

<Tag>
  <Label>Title</Label>
  <DataTag>b:BookTitle</DataTag>
  <TitlePriority>2</TitlePriority>
  <Sample>Example: How to Write Bibliographies</Sample>
</Tag>

<Tag>
  <Label>Title</Label>
  <DataTag>b:TitleBook</DataTag>
  <TitlePriority>1</TitlePriority>
  <Sample>Example: How to Write Bibliographies</Sample>
</Tag>

The types.xml is just input file for BibType and is normally only used once. The only use for BibType (and types.xml) is in an international environment where you have to "patch" bibform.xml files in multiple languages. If that's not your case, you are better of to manually extend your one bibform.xml yourself.
